oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Educational facilities; Schools; Education
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee; Alvin C. York Agricultural Institute
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front view of York Institute in Fentress County. It is a large brick or stone building set amid pines, and has multiple windows and a low sloped roof. The words "York Institute" are laid out on the grass in the foreground.

Famed World War I hero Alvin Cullum York (1887-1964) raised funds in order to provide impoverished Fentress County boys and girls the education that had been denied him. The result was a private agricultural school that operated from 1926 to 1937. In 1937, the General Assembly transferred operations to the State Board of Education.
